title: Sharp corners, V below baseline, E middle bar shorter
author: girtst

comments.content: As I don't know any font with /V point "so far below baseline", I'd probably start with one among [Engravers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112223/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/engravers+gothic/)/ [Blair](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112223/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/blair/)/ [Sackers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112223/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/sackers+gothic/) (and may be more **Blair** for this one) and customize /V.

All /E bars have different length...  
It looks like an **[ITC Blair Medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112223/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=ITC&ffam=Blair%20ITC%20Medium%20-%20Regular&fid=fbf9ba458f381e818b658265153ba5a3&fsize=60&text=VERVE&fit=1)** with a modified /V (to make it pointy and that's probably why it extends bellow baseline)

PS: I see Ryuk also agrees on Blair
Thank you both, it is Blair! Great tip on customizing /V.
